title: Instructional Design Scenarios for Self-Directed Learning (SDL) Competency Enhancement in Problem-Based Learning (PBL) Environments

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational language proficiency and possession of professional (basic medical/legal/technical) knowledge
context.additional_context: PBL (Project-Based Learning) classroom environment using smartphone-based CAL (Computer-Assisted Learning) modules. Learners are professionals requiring advanced expertise in the language domain. Operated with a focus on formative assessment.

learning_goals: Learners can independently analyze language problems presented in the PBL scenario and develop solution strategies.
Learners can apply SDL (Self-Directed Learning) skills according to Gagné’s Nine Events of Instruction through the CAL (Computer-Assisted Learning) module.
Learners can achieve weekly learning goals at over 80% in a smartphone environment and maintain self-assessment records.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
